action.action-desc: Ms. Hageman introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Natural Resources

form.official-title: To amend the Mineral Leasing Act to improve the assessment of expression of interest fees, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Expression of Interest Sensibility Act.

subsection.text: Section 17(b)(1)(A) of the Mineral Leasing Act (30 U.S.C. 226(b)(1)(A)) is amended by striking the remainder of the bonus bid, if any, and inserting , as applicable, the remainder of the bonus bid, the fee for the expression of interest under subsection (q)(2)(B),.
Section 17(q) of the Mineral Leasing Act (30 U.S.C. 226(q)) is amendedâ€”

paragraph.text: in the heading, by striking Fee for;
by amending paragraph (1) to read as follows:

A person may, in accordance with procedures established by the Secretary to carry out this subsection, submit an expression of interest in leasing land available for disposition under this section for exploration for, and development of, oil or gas.

subparagraph.text: If land covered by an expression of interest submitted under paragraph (1) is offered at a lease sale and no bid is received for such land, the Secretary shall assess at the time of the sale a fee for the expression of interest against the person that submitted the first expression of interest for the land.

If land covered by an expression of interest submitted under paragraph (1) receives a successful bid at a lease sale, the Secretary shall assess a fee for the expression of interest against the successful bidder.

paragraph.text: in paragraph (3), as so redesignated, by striking paragraph (1) and inserting paragraph (2); and
by adding at the end the following:
An expression of interest submitted under this section shall remain active for a term of not less than 5 years unless the land covered by the expression of interest is offered at a lease sale.
